p: The main reported vectors of West Nile virus (WNV) are Culex spp. Transmission is mainly zoonotic but with significant levels of human infection, including occasional mortality [ 84]. A pool of An. pauliani wild unfed females was found to be positive for WNV RNA by RT-PCR in Madagascar [ 23]. A pool of An. maculipennis collected in Italy between 2008 and 2012 was also found positive for WNV RNA by RT-PCR [ 61]. A pool of An. maculipennis collected in Serbia after the 2012 WNV outbreak was also positive for WNV RNA by RT-PCR, which suggested a potential important role for this species in transmission [ 62].
